statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: LSU-Shreveport 79, Northwestern St. 73
article.story: NATCHITOCHES, La. (AP) -- Josh Porter had 20 points and Jared Stevenson 16 as LSU-Shreveport beat Northwestern St. 79-73 on Saturday to remain undefeated. LSU-Shreveport (10-0), which led 43-36 at halftime, scored the last six points to win a contest with eight ties and five lead changes. Jamon Morris, who finished with 14 points and 13 rebounds, hit a basket with 1:36 left to put the Pilots up 75-73. Clarke Jackson stole the ball and hit a layup with 1:02 left to put them ahead of the Demons (4-6) by four points. A 3-point shot by the Demons' Michael McConathy rattled in and out with 52 seconds left. Jackson got the rebound but Porter missed a 3-point shot with 20 seconds left. Stevenson sank two free throws after a traveling violation by the Demons with 12 seconds left for the final score. The Pilots also got 11 points and 12 rebounds from Travis Cash. Trey Gilder had 31 points and 17 rebounds for the Demons. Gerrell Thomas added 14 points and 13 rebounds, reserve Deividas Petravicius had 13 points, and Colby Bargeman had 10 rebounds as well as six points. LSUS had earlier exhibition victories over McNeese State and Centenary, Division I rivals of Northwestern. The Demons were unable to convert a 54-43 rebounding advantage, including 25 offensive rebounds. Gilder was 12-for-22 and Petravicius 4-of-5, but the the rest of the Demons made only 9 of 48 shots from the floor.
